name: Hotel Rex

reviews.title: Good situation!
reviews.text: Hotel Rex is next to St. Lorenzo Church, and 2 min. walking from Duomo. We spent there 2 nights.

reviews.title: Best to be used just as a pit stop
reviews.text: The room was clean and the breakfast buffet was O.K. The staff was nice.

reviews.title: Never stay in this hotel
reviews.text: You have a parking(20€/day) close to the hotel.

reviews.title: Don't stay here
reviews.text: The room was very small and in desperate need of decoration however if you looked passed the peeling wallpaper and dislodged ceiling tiles it was as clean as possible. The bathroom was again small, required decoration however clean. No power shower but the mains powered shower did the job. I can understand why the other reports on this hotel are poor, as the 3 star rating is a bit surprising however if you just want a clean bed to put your head down in every night that isn't going to cost a fortune go for it. We only had 3 days in Florence so we didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room anyway Our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking the Irish bar it was a bit noisy so if you're a light sleeper request a room at the back of the hotel or bring earplugs.Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast just basic no thrills tea/coffee, cereals, croissants, rolls, preserves and tinned fruit.The main thing this hotel has going for it is the location, its central to all the main places of interest with just a 3 min walk from the Cathedral if that.On summary I would say go to this hotel just don't go with any great expectations.

This hotel was a great find. It is a typical older European hotel, meaning it is not perfect. But it was easy to find, centrally located to all major sites and trains, clean and accomodating. This hotel is old, the walls do need a fresh papering (the floors in our back corner room were tiled), but if you are looking for an affordable place to stay, consider this hotel. Although many of the previous reviews were negative, and I was apprehensive, I have no serious complaints. The worse thing I can say is that the tub was small and the bathroom light/fan buzzed annoyingly.
reviews.title: Normal Euro Hotel-great deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to meet the reviewer who gave this hotel a 3 star rating. Comparing this to other 3 star hotels, 1-2 stars should be removed. A very tired hotel that needs major upgrading. The furniture had seen better days, the carpet needed changing not cleaning. The photos of the hotel looked good but they were misleading. The staff were okay but they can only work with what they got. It was "centrally located" and that was good because but you would not want to spend much time in your room. Florence is a beautiful city but the hotel put a sour note to our holiday time.
reviews.title: Can do better

likes.disliked: — The room looked and felt dirty

reviews.title: Great location but...
reviews.text: Location was great, close to the train station, street market, restaurants, attractions and even close to our tour CAF travel office. However, the room was quite dirty and the carpet had stains on them. Also, under the floor carpet there were peices of garbage. The shower curtain did not close all the way down so water got everywhere onto the bathroom floor. The hoilet was also inside the shower part so we had to wipe everything down after using the shower so that the next person could use the toilet without getting all wet. The wall paper on the wall was peeling off and the room was very dusty. The TV in our room did not work at all. We had ask for a different room the next day because we could not stand the room. The receptionist spoke well english and was very friendly and helpful. Overall this hotel was in a central location but the rooms were run down. Breakfast was alright, mainly consisted of fruit and cereal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were stuck with this hotel on the easter long weekend.
reviews.title: Look else where!
Great Little Hotel
reviews.text: Dark, dingy, water damaged floorings, a terrible breakfast and surly reception staff , need I say more.

The hotel is a tired. The capet and wallcovering is old and in need of updating.Bathrooms are poor by all standards. The staff is friendly and helpful. The biggest problem is the noise level in the evening. Threre is a Irish bar across the street and a Brazilan disco next door. If you don't mind waiting until 4:00am to go to sleep. This hotel is right for you!
reviews.title: No sleep in Florence

reviews.text: I would like to thank you for providing such a nice place to stay while we visited Florence last week. Our room number 407 was perfect and the balcony was an unexpected bonus and the perfect vantage point from which to enjoy the beautiful panoramic skyline of Florence. Everyone at the hotel was professional, polite and friendly, ultimately this helped make our first trip to Florence and Italy a big success. We will certainly return to your hotel and will recommend it to our friends and relatives. Keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Dear Hotel San Giorgio... thank you so much

reviews.text: i love this hotel! true it is a little old but so what you are in Florence... true the owners Mr and Mrs Lodovichi do lounge around the TV room watching mind numbing tv shows but so what this is their hotel and the fact that they were there from wednesday to friday shows that they care about their hotel and its' guests! The hotel's biggest plus point is the location which is superb as you can literally fall out of bed slap bang bump right into the middle of the Historical Centre of Florence. The rooms don't rock instead they creak but that is simply because the building is so old... The hotel is full of Florentine Character and you will have a superb time chatting to Paolo and the other evening receptionists who are only too willing to help you with your evening's entertainment. I will definitely return to the Hotel Rex.
reviews.title: Rolling Rolling Rolling Rex is Really Rocking
No-Star Hotel
reviews.text: Internet pix of Hotel Rex are totally misleading. The wallpaper and carpet are badly stained. The room AC is ineffective. The bathroom is just a large shower with a curtain between the floor drain and the toilet/bidet. Maintenance and redecoration seem to have been deferred permanently. The staff are demoralized. Worst hotel I’ve seen since the night I spent in a fleabag for a college sociology course on homelessness.
Like other reviewers we were a little apprehensive, as some reviews were negative.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July 2005.
reviews.title: Small and noisy

reviews.text: The hotel was very close to the train station, so we found the hotel easily by foot.
reviews.title: Avoid Hotel Rex
Hotel Rex Rocks even if a Little Old
reviews.text: The rooms were small, with a tiny bathroom. The shower flooded the bathroom easily, so bath-slippers were needed. The view from the window was a dirty alley, and provided no light for the room.

reviews.title: Fond memories of the Rex
reviews.text: On the other hand, the air conditioner worked fine and there was a refridgerator as well.

reviews.title: fantastic, clean hotel, great breakfast, prime location,afordable
reviews.text: We could easily hear our neighbours. At the time we were there, there was also a lot of loud youths who kept yelling and running in the hallways. We wished the reception could speak up, on behalf of all the guests who got disturbed.

reviews.title: Quaint and clean place
reviews.text: Wonderful time, nice staff, clean room and great breakfast. Thanks!

We stayed at Hotel Rex for 5 nights, and overall the experience was ok. Our room was very small. We had three people, so we had the "triple" room with 3 smaller than avg twin size beds, but from judging from all our research before we booked this room, most of the hotels in rome looked like they had relatively small rooms. Also, the bathroom was huge, but the bathtub was tiny and high so if you are tall you would hit the mildew infested celing. The showerhead was detachable but not really usable as a real shower because if you hung it up on the stand, then it would shoot straight across the bathtub and get the bathroom floor all wet, you would still be dry in the bathtub. Overall the bathroom was clean besides the ceiling of course, and the sheets were always crisp and clean, which was good and the there was plenty of hot water. we did not use the ac since it was pretty cool when we went. The rooms are probably a little outdated, but if you just need a clean place to stay this place works. Its in an excellent location, near the main train station so you never have to go far to get a bus or train. Also, I read in another review of this hotel that you have to leave the keys with the front desk. YES, you "have" to leave the keys which is kind of weird, that is what we were told when we took them with us one day. and also, there is only one entrance to the hotel so they know everytime you go in and out, which is kinda weird. You can always use the safe in the room for valuables. Also, apparently Italy has several different types of plugs, so you have to have a shape changer which the front desk was out of. The breakfast was ok, they had the basic things. Overall the hotel was pretty good, def. not "four star" quality but clean with a good location. Also, the TV was ok, we didn't really get any channels in english so we were basiclly out of touch.
reviews.title: Great Location, Ok hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to find, not too far from the station. Easy access to Metro and buses, or you can walk to many places without too much effort.
reviews.title: We needed a break and really enjoyed it
Good Location
reviews.text: Staff very friendly and helpful; reception staff all spoke good English, but let us try our limited Italian!

reviews.title: Sleepless in Rome
reviews.text: The room was fine: decent sized, clean and comfortable - better than many I have used in London.

reviews.title: Average and Overpriced
reviews.text: We would recommend the nearby Restaurant Guglio - excellent food, house wine and service.

description: Family owned & managed with modern ensuite facilities; located 200 meters from Santa Maria Novella Rail Station; near the Duomo.
